tone_framing: Frame the tour as a treasure hunt to uncover stories hidden in colors, animals, and myths
key_takeaways: Green was a color of prestige and beauty in ancient China.
Imperial courts prized multi-colored ceramic wares for their craftsmanship and symbolism.
Southern Song dynasty artifacts often showcase delicate white-green glazes.
creative_activities: Design your own mythical animal plate: Provide students with paper plates and colored markers to create a design using the wucai palette (red, green, brown, yellow). Encourage them to include a mythical animal and explain its symbolism.
Color exploration game: Show students various artifacts with shades of green glaze and ask them to guess what emotions or meanings the colors might represent in ancient Chinese culture.
